name: Aloysius Jones
biography: Lived well, loved hard, died young. test

name: Barnie Rubble
biography: Lived in a stone house

name: Testing New Writer
biography:
test biography and

line breaks.

name: test writer 2
biography: test biography

name: test writer 3
biography: test

name: test writer 3 test
biography: est

name: test writer 4
biography: test

name: Writer 5
biography: testing biographical data for Writer 5

name: Ammonius Sakkas
biography: Active in Alexandria.

name: Cassius Longinus
biography: Taught in Athens. End of life: adviser to Palmyrians Septimius Odaenathus Zenobia. Killed by Aurelian.

name: Plotinus
biography: 205, Lycopolis(?)-270, Campania. 230's, studied in Alexandria. 243, travels to Persia with Gordian. 244, escapes to Antioch. 250's-60's, patronised in Rome. Later, leaves for Campania.

name: Amelius Gentilianus
biography: Born in Etruria. From 246-269, he was a student of Plotinus in Rome, and he retired in Apamea.

name: Porphyry
biography: 234-305. Born in Tyre (Phoenicia), studied in Athens (Longinus). At 263, he joins Plotinus in Rome. 268, sojourns in Sicily.

name: Iamblichus
biography: Chalcis (Coele-Syria). Died in Apamea (?). Studied in Rome, or Sicily, with Porphyry. 290's, taught in Daphne (Antioch or Caesarea Philippi). Taught in Apamea. Levitates.

name: Ulpianus
biography: Taught rhetoric in Emesa, Antioch, from 324-337.

name: Theodore
biography: From Greece. Established (Porphyrian) school (not in Pergamum).

name: Dexippus
biography: Taught in his own school.

name: Sopater (I)
biography: Born in Apamea (?), 300, d. 337, Constantinople. Active in Constantinople. 326-- foremost Neoplatonist after Iamblichus. 330's, joins court of Constantine. Adviser of Constantine.

name: Eustathius
biography: Left Sosipatra (wife) and Antoninus (son) in the 340's (to pursue politics?). 355-356, in Antioch. 358, on a mission to Persia.

name: Aedesius
biography: d. 351-355 in Pergamum. Takes over school after Sopatros (Apamea?). 351, visited by Julian.

name: Prohaeresius
biography: 276, Cappadocia-367/68. Studied in Antioch and Athens. Succeeds Julianus in Athens. Invited by Constans to Gaul.

name: Maximus
biography: d. 371. 361-d., set up as teacher in Ephesus by Julian. 364, imprisoned by Valens. Defended by Themistius.

name: Sopater (II)
Eusebius
biography: Pergamum.

name: Sosipatra
biography: b. 300-310, Ephesus; d. late 360's (?), post-husband. Late 330's, she arrives in Pergamum. 351, she meets Julian on his visit. Teachers unknown. Taught in Pergamum under care of Aedesius.

name: Priscus
biography: c. 305-c. 395. Pergamum. Did not suffer persecution after Julian's death. Included in Julian's circle, and later moved to Athens.

name: Chrysanthius
biography: Resisted the court of Julian. 361/3, was the high priest of Lydia by Julian. Sardis.

name: Iamblichus (II)
biography: Son or nephew of Sopatros (II). Started school in Athens and was recognized by city for wisdom and largesse.

name: Chrysanthius
biography: Resisted the court of Julian. 361/3, was the high priest of Lydia by Julian. Sardis.

name: Libanius
biography: 314, Antioch-393, Antioch. Curial family-educated first in Antioch. From 336-340, studied in Athens. From 340/1-346, taught rhetoric in Constantinople and Nicomedia. 354, taught rhetoric in Antioch.

name: Themistius
biography: 317, Paphlagonia-388, Constantinople. Educated in the East and Constantinople. In 345, he opens rhetoric school in Constantinople. Traveled often in the imperial entourage. Received patronage from every emperor from Constantius II-Theodosius I.

name: Antoninus
biography: ca. 320-ca.390. Bathygeras, ca. Alexandria (canopic mouth of the Nile)-ascetic, esoteric school of Platonism; = theurgic.

name: Diodore
biography: d. ca. 390. Native of Antioch.

name: Meletius the Confessor
biography: d. 381. Head of the church of Antioch.

name: Plutarch the Younger
biography: 340 or 370-432 (too old to lecture). Part of Athens school, possible student of Priscus or Iamblichus (II). Son of a certain Nestorius (not the well-known Nestorius).

name: Sallustius
biography: Consul in 363.

name: Eunapius
biography: b. 345, Sardis. Studied in Sardis with Chrysanthius, studied in Athens with Prohaeresius.

name: Theon
biography: fl. 364, Alexandria

name: Synesius
biography: ca. 370-413. From 397-400, an ambassador to Constantinople. In 410, a bishop of Libya (Ptolemais). His wife and brothers were Christians.

name: Hypatia
biography: d. 415, Alexandria. Married to an Isidorus, not the Isidorus of Athens.

name: Theodore
biography: 350, Antioch-428, Mopsuestia. Became a priest in 383.

name: John Chrysostom
biography: b. 344-354, d. September 14, 407. 381, deacon. Priest in 386 by Bishop Flavian. Bishop of Constantinople in 398. Deposed by Synod of the Oak 403.

name: John
biography: d. 441. Bishop of Antioch in 429. Got tangled up in Nestorian controversy, reconciled with Cyril in 433.

name: Nestorius
biography: b. after 381, Germanicia, d. after 450. Attended school of Antioch, bishop of Constantinople in 428, deposed at Ephesus in 431.

name: Syrianus
biography: 431-432, succeeds Plutarch the Younger.

name: Hierocles
biography: Taught in Alexandria ca. 435, arrested and exiled.

name: Theosebius
biography: Neo-platonic philosopher.

name: Proclus
biography: 412, Constantinople-485. First educated in Lycia. Educated in law in Alexandria, philosophy. From 430/1, moves to Athens. In 437, succeeds Syrianus. ??? "taught Isidore"-which? Of Pelusium or Isidorus?

name: Hermias
biography: Taught in Alexandria.

name: Aeneas
biography:
* look up Gesius (iatrosophist).

d. c. 518.

name: Ammonius Hermiae
biography: 435/45-517/26. 470, taught in Alexandria. 475-483/5, Damascius hears him. 515, Olympiodorus hears him.

name: Isidorus
biography: From Alexandria; studied in Athens.

name: Eutocius
biography: Succeeded Ammonius Hermiae.

name: Damascius
biography: b. in Damascus early in 2nd half of 5th-c., d. post-538 in Syria. Studied in Alexandria under Ammonius and Isidore. In 492, he moved to Athens (Marinus, Zenodotus). Headed school in Athens. In 529, school of Athens closed. 532, signs a treaty (unknown location).

name: Leontius the Hermit
biography: 475-543/4, Byzantium.

name: Zacharias (Rhetor, Scholasticus)
biography:
b. Gaza, d. before 553. Studied in Gaza, Alexandria; later bishop of Mytilene, sometimes reported as "Melitene."

Wrote extant Lives of Peter the Iberian, Isaiah of Scetis, and Severus, as well as a history which, compressed, survives in the larger Historia Ecclesiastica of ps-Zachariah. Though he wrote in Greek, his works survive in Syriac.

name: Choricius
biography: Successor to Procopius.

name: John Philoponos
biography: circa 490-570's, Alexandria.

name: Olympiodorus
biography: b. 495-505. Taught in Alexandria up to and past 565. Scholarch by 541. Succeeded Eutocius.

name: Simplicius
biography: In 529, he travels to Persia with Damascius, maybe settled in Couriae (Baghdad), or in Athens.

name: David
biography: "of Armenia."

name: Stephanus
Pseudo-Elias
biography: Prefect of Illyrium (?), 541.

name: Origen
biography: 185-253. Born in Alexandria, died in Tyre. Head of school at Alexandria ca. 203.

name: Athenadoras
biography: b. 215, Pontus

name: Gregory Thaumaturgus
biography: 213, Pontus-270. Bishop of Neocaesaerea.

name: Antony
biography: 250, Coma-356, Mount Colzim. Moved to Pispir in 285, organizes community in 305, and eastern desert community 313.

name: Macrina the Elder
biography: d. 340, Neocaesarea. Grandmother of Cappadocians.

name: Basil the Elder
biography: Teacher of rhetoric (?).

name: Pior
biography: d. 360. Solitary in Kellia for 30 years.

name: Cyril
biography: 315, Jerusalem-387. Bishop of Jerusalem from 349-.

name: Pope Damasus
biography: 304-384. Got in fight with Ursinus for papacy, fought heretics.

name: Martin
biography: 315/336-397. Bishop of Tours, 371; patron saint of France. Founded monastery of LigugÃ©, 360.

name: Epiphanius
biography: 315, Eleutheropolis-May 12, 403, en route to Cyprus. Founded monastery near birthplace ca. 345. Teamed up with Theophilus to battle Origenists.

name: Didymus the Blind
biography: 313-398. Last head of catechetical school of Alexandria.

name: Athanasius
biography: 295-373, Alexandria.

name: Ammun
biography:
294-357. At Kellia in Nitria in 332.

?Âµ??? = ?ÂµÂµ??.

name: Macarius the Great
biography: 300-390. Retired to the desert in 330.

name: Macarius
biography: 300-394. Monk. "The Younger," or "The Alexandrian," to distinguish from the Great, the Egyptian.

name: Ammonus
biography:
d. before 396. 



	
	
	
	
	<style>
		<!-- 
		BODY,DIV,TABLE,THEAD,TBODY,TFOOT,TR,TH,TD,P { font-family:"Verdana"; font-size:x-small }
		 --></style>ca. 356, succeeds Antony in Pispir monastery.

name: Hilarion
biography: 293, Gaza-373, Cyprus. Studied in Alexandria, where he converted to Christianity.

name: Gregory
biography: 335, Neocaesarea-394. Ordained Bishop of Nyssa, 371. Attended Council of Constantinople, 381.

name: Gregory the Theologian
biography: 330, Arianzum, Cappadocia-389/390. School of rhetoric in Cappadocia, school in C. in Palestine, Alexandria, Athens. Bishop of Sasima, 371. Bishop of Nazianzus, 374. Bishop of Constantinople, 381, but not for long.

name: Basil the Great
biography: 330, Caesarea, Cappadocia-379. Taught at Caesarea, Constantinople and Athens. Returned to Caesarea in 356, made bishop of C. in 370.

name: Macrina the Younger
biography: 327-379. Established ascetic community on the family estate at Pontus.

name: Augustine
biography: 13th Nov, 354, Tagaste, Numidia-28th Aug, 430, Hippo. Converted to Christianity in 387. Ca 396, bishop of Hippo.

name: Ambrose
biography: 339, Trier-397. Son of praetorian prefect of Gaul. Studied in Greek rhetoric and poetry. Bishop of Milan, 374. Mediated a conflict between Maximus and Valentinian II.

name: Paulinus
biography: 353, Bordeaux-June 22, 431, Nola. Baptized in 390.

name: Jerome
biography: 331, Stridan-30 September, 420, Bethlehem. Learned Hebrew in Syrian desert, studied at Antioch, traveled everywhere.

name: Rufinus
biography: ?, Elusa, Gaul- d. November 27, 395, Constantinople.

name: Melania the Elder
biography: 342-410. Founded monastery with Rufinus at Mount of Olives.

name: Arsenius
biography: mid. 4th century, Rome (ca. 354)-455, Troa. Went to join monks at Scetis ca. 390, possibly of Roman senatorial class.

name: John Kolobos (the Dwarf)
biography: d. 409. Withdrew from Scetis 407 to Klisma.

name: Theophilus
biography: d. 412. Patriarch of Alexandria, 385-412. Condemned Origenism at Synod of Alexandria, 401.

name: Cyril
biography: d. 444. Born, raised, educated at Alexandria. Attended Synod of the Oak. Attended 3rd Ecumenical Council.

name: The Tall Brothers
biography: Ammonios (d. 403); Dioscorus (d. 402); Eusebius; Euthymius.

name: Evagrius
biography: 345, Ibora, Pontus-399. Attended Council of Constantinople, 381. Went to Egypt, 382.

name: Paphnutius
biography: "of Scetis." Maybe the same as "the Hermit."

name: Shenoute
biography: 348(?)-466. At White Monastery in Atripe from 383-466.

name: Isidore
biography: 360, Alexandria-435.

name: Palladius
biography: 363/364, Galatia-431. Goes to Egypt, 388. Goes to Kellia, 390.

name: Po(i)emen
biography: 340-450. Scetis.

name: Anub
biography: d. 460. Scetis, Therenutis.

name: Bessarion
biography: 4th century, Scetis. Saint in Coptic church.

name: Dulas
biography: Dulas

name: Flavian
biography: d. 449. Patriarch of Constantinople, 446.

name: Eutyches
biography: 378-454. Archimandrite of monastery at Constantinople. Deposed at Chalcedon in 451.

name: Melania the Younger
biography: 383, Rome-December 31, 439, Jerusalem.

name: Dioscorus
biography: d. 454. Archdeacon of Alexandria under Cyril. Succeeded to Patriarch in 444.

name: Pulcheria
biography: 399-453. Empress in 450.

name: Chrysaphius
biography: Eunuch in Constantinople who controlled Theodosius II from the 440's to death.

name: Theodoret
biography: 393, Antioch-466. Born at Antioch, bishop of Cyrus from 423. Sided with John of Antioch at Ephesus.

name: Peripatetic Anatolius
biography: Bishop of Laodicea.

name: Julian Imp.
biography: 331, Constantinople-363, Persia. 337, in care of Arian bishop. 342-348, house arrest in Cappadocia. 351, converts to paganism/neoplatonism. 356-359, Gaul wars. 361-363, emperor. 362-363, Persia/Antioch operations.

name: Arcadius
biography: Emperor 383-408.

name: Priscian
biography: Exiled with Simplicius, Damascius, Phoenician Hermias, Diogenes, Phrygian Eulonius and Isidore

name: Hermias
biography: Exiled with Simplicius, Damascius, Priscium of Lydia, Diogenes, Phrygian Eulonius, Isidore

name: Diogenes
biography: Exiled with Simplicius, Damascius, Priscium of Lydia, Phoenician Hermias, Phrygian Eulonius, Isidore

name: Eulonius
biography: Exiled with Simplicius, Damascius, Priscium of Lydia, Phoenician Hermias, Phrygian Eulonius, Isidore

name: Isidore
biography: Exiled with Simplicius, Damascius, Priscium of Lydia, Phoenician Hermias, Phrygian Eulonius, Isidore

name: Acacius "One-Eyed"
biography: Succeeded Eusebius (Sozomen HE 3.5).

name: Eusebius
biography: Martyr

name: Moses
biography: "the Black."

name: Dorotheos
biography: b. Antioch, studied rhetoric somewhere (trad. under Procopius, in Gaza), corresponded with Barsanuphius and John before entering the monastery they supervised, in Thawatha, under abba Seridos.

name: Barsanuphius and John
biography: The "Great Old Man" and the "Other Old Man" of Gaza. Enmured.

name: Gessius "Iatrosophist"
biography:
See E. Watts's article (CC license): http://grbs.library.duke.edu/article/view/1101.

aka Gesius.

in Brill's New Pauly: http://referenceworks.brillonline.com/entries/brill-s-new-pauly/gesius-e423430?s.num=0&s.f.s2_parent=s.f.book.brill-s-new-pauly&s.q=gesius.

name: Severus
biography: Rejected the Henotikon.

name: Zeno
biography: The disciple of Silvanus listed in the AP, who later ("Abbot") taught Peter the Iberian, does not match the description of St Zeno the Hermit, a supposed disciple of Basil the Great. There were many Zenos, including contemporary bishops of Maiuma and Gaza who may be identified with the disciple of Silvanus (?).

name: Zacharias
biography: The Zacharias under Zeta in the AP seems different from the Zacharias repeatedly mentioned under Silvanus's entry in the AP. Neither should be identified with Zacharias Rhetor, although Z. Rhetor, like the disciple of Silvanus, was active in Palestine, and the two were roughly contemporary.-- DSW
